title: Californian wines are moving in new directions - this is why you should invest now
text:
In case you hadn’t noticed, the Californians have designs on the empty spaces in your cellar. It’s nothing new to consider seasoning a collection that majors on Bordeaux and Burgundy with a few choice selections from cult Napa producers. But last week’s Collectible California tasting set out a different agenda.

Held at the American Embassy in London, and aimed squarely at the trade, it showcased over 150 wines (with a minimum price of £50 a bottle) from producers who included Sandhi, Inglenook, Ridge, Hirsch, Trinchero, Schramsberg, Stony Hill, Harlan Estate and Stag’s Leap.

Earlier in the week, I met up with Harlan Estate’s Don Weaver for a miniature vertical of the producer’s very sleek Bordeaux-style...
